poem:
The New Machines

Amidst the chatter of a banking hall,  
The cold efficiency of numbers grind.  
Currency whispers its stories of rise and fall;  
Outside, silent engines edge the humankind.  
Jobs, like autumn leaves, scatter where AI walks—  
The future presses on, indifferent to old chalks.  
In the heart's quiet chamber, echoes of loss unwind.
